intro: Oxydectes alnoidea, commonly known as the alderleaf sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is native to wetland and riparian habitats in North America, particularly in the eastern United States. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are often dark green and slightly hairy. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Oxydectes alnoidea plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic and terrestrial wildlife.
